prs.title: docs(solana examples): update keygen related instructions
prs.truncated_body: The current instruction to run solana-keygen new is redundant as keypair generation will be done by anchor keys sync if keys do not yet exist.

prs.title: feat: go-mod-cache install plugins,tools
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes

- Collapses `go-cache` and `go-cache-self-hosted` job into matrix job
- Checks if there was a primary cache hit before installing, if there was then the cache will not be saved so installing is a waste of time.
- Now installs `loopinstall`, plugins, and some test tools
- Don't restore from existing cache if creating new entry.
	- The idea here is that if we restore from an older

commits.message: fix: propagate runner label, add perms
fix: dont install if cache already exists
fix: minimize restores if saving module cache

- Add on push trigger for CodeQL
- Restore build cache for PRs only

```
Analyze (go)
1 issue was detected with this workflow: Please specify an on.push hook to analyze and see code scanning alerts from the default branch on the Security tab.

Analyze (go)
Unable t

fix: dont create build cache for PRs

prs.title: chore: bump reusable-docker-build-publish workflow ref
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes

Bumps `reusable-docker-build-publish` to:
  - https://github.com/smartcontractkit/.github/pull/1077
  - https://github.com/smartcontractkit/.github/pull/1076

### Context

We previously disabled the cache due to intermittent failures (#17378)
> We were seeing intermittent failures (example) in CI at a ~10-15% rate with cache enabled. GitHub's cache is only 10 GB or so per rep

prs.title: feat: self-hosted runners for e2e image build
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes

-  Move to self-hosted runners for E2E test's image builds

### Motivation

Should speed-up image builds by many minutes.

### Testing

I've tested this a lot (amongst other changes in #17932), but carved out this specific portion to make changes more atomic.

Before
- Regular image ~4m20s, plugins 5m20s (https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink/actions/runs/15474699

commits.message: feat: self-hosted runners for e2e image build

prs.title: op-acceptance-tests: Migrate sync test not to use Supervisor MultiNode support, removing RedundancyInterop
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Supervisor is dropping multi-node support. Therefore we must update the interop sync test which were dependent with this removed feature.

Removed `RedundantInterop` which relied on multinode support, as well as patching `TestL2CLAheadOfSupervisor` which implicitly

commits.message: Capitalize logs and add simple helper
Do not rely supervisor multinode support
reduce CI time and explicit supervisor comments

remove redundant interop system

supervisor dropped multinode support so became irrelevant

prs.title: fix(blob clients): nil pointer with unexpected blob client response
prs.truncated_body:
## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR
This PR fixes an issue where the blob client API delivers an unexpected response that is not checked for length before accessed. 

```
WARN [06-05|06:46:37.665] BlobClients: failed to get blob by versioned hash from BlobClient err="beacon node request failed, status: 404 Not Found, body: {\"code\":404,\"message\":\"NOT_FOUND: no blobs stored for blo

commits.message: fix nil pointer with unexpected blob client response

prs.title: Allow mining if DevFakeAuthor is enabled
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

In case of public networks, the worker doesn't start mining if the node isn't connected to peers. For the purposes of shadow forking, it is necessary to allow the node to mine blocks in its own fork whilst not listening to peers. This PR enables this. 

# Changes

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change that solves an issue)
- [ ] Hotfix (change that solves an urgent issue, and r

commits.message: consensus,miner: allow mining in case of no peers if DevFakeAuthor is enabled
miner: explicitly assert consensus engine type

prs.title: quic: fine-grained pkt_meta alloc metrics
prs.truncated_body: This PR replaces pkt_tx_alloc_fail_cnt with an enum metric measuring success and two failure reasons. Because a given piece of outgoing data will increment failure each iteration of service until it succeeds, adding success count lets us look at the proportion of service iterations that were successful.

Before

prs.title: feat(fortuna): add result count to results
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Add a total result count field to the fortuna logs response

## Rationale

This is necessary so we can implement a paginator on the UI since we need to know how many pages there are (or at the very least, we need to know if there's a next page).

## How has this been tested?

- [x] Current tests cover my changes
- [x] Added new tests
- [x] Manually tested the code

<!-- D

commits.message:
feat(fortuna): add result count to results

This is necessary so we can implement a paginator on the UI since we need to
know how many pages there are (or at the very least, we need to know if there's
a next page).

prs.title: feat(fortuna): refactor explorer endpoint & history query methods
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

This commit implements a few fixes for the fortuna explorer endpoint, and in doing so I refactored the query methods.  We are now using a query builder approach which enables the filters, limits, offsets, etc to all work correctly regardless of the query supplied.

This commit also implements a new query param to filter on state.

## Rationale

The prior implementation of the h

commits.message:
feat(fortuna): refactor explorer endpoint & history query methods

This commit implements a few fixes for the fortuna explorer endpoint, and in
doing so I refactored the query methods.  We are now using a query builder
approach which enables the filters, limits, offsets, etc to all work correctly
regardless of the query supplied.

This commit also implements a new query param to filter on state.
fix(fortuna): use query builder and add comprehensive indices
fix(fortuna): improve tests for query builder
fix(fortuna): re-add indices on tx hash

prs.title: fix(apps/price_pusher) handle price feed removal more gracefully
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

The price pusher in many networks would throw an error if a feed doesn't exist and the behaviour was there to prevent config errors but it falls short when we remove a feed. This change adds a warning for non existent feeds but lets the pusher keep functioning (for the remaining feeds).

## How has this been tested?

- [x] Manually tested the code: tested missing feeds (another c

commits.message:
fix(apps/price_pusher): ignore invalid price updates on push

when a feed is not found, the code throws an error which is
typically good but often a feed is removed and that results
in the entire push failing. this change adds the flag to ignore
invalid price updates, which allows the push to continue.
fix(apps/price_pusher): better price feed listener error handling
fix(apps/price_pusher): do not push if source price is undefined

- Closes https://github.com/stacks-network/stacks-core/issues/6088

- Validating that a proposed block contains the replay set (if we're in replay mode)

- Adds a feature flag to the signer for whether or not to validate blocks against the replay set. We'll want to remove this feature flag as part of https:

prs.title: fix: clear sources in Dockerfile before the COPY
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

This is a lingering "bug" that only strikes when building a docker image locally where the local branch has conflicting changes with what is on main in a particular way.

## Changes

* Clear the sources downloaded from main before copying over our local changes.

## Testing Information

I tested this out on the `feat/sql-transactions` branch by making a conflicting change

Update the devenv sbtc dockerfile to clear out
source code before copying over the new sources

prs.title: fix: skip DKG if latest shares are unverified
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Currently if we need to DKG because of config changes we will keep doing DKGs until we get a confirmed rotate key tx. But if we don't manage to DKG + verify + rotate key submission in the same bitcoin tenure, we will "discard" the previous progress and just start a new round.

## Changes

Prevent DKG if latest shares are unverified. 

## Testing Information

## Checklist:

commits.message: fix: skip DKG if latest shares are unverified

prs.title: Improve logdb inmem
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

- Optimized in-memory SQLite database configuration in `logdb/logdb.go` for better test performance
- Optimized SQLite settings in `logdb/logdb.go` for in-memory operations:
  - `synchronous=OFF`
  - `journal_mode=MEMORY`
  - `cache_size=-2000`
  - `temp_store=MEMORY`

Fixes # (issue)

prs.title: HF for disabling SC creation and forward transfers
prs.truncated_body:
To support the Horizen migration, a new hard fork has been implemented at a specified block height (to be determined) that disables the creation of new sidechains and the forwarding of funds to existing sidechains. Note that backward transfers and certificate processing will remain functional after the fork point.

See JIRA task at: https://horizenlabs.atlassian.net/browse/HZN-2258

commits.message: First implementation for new fork point that prevents creation of new sidechains and ft to existing  ones
Added first implementation for py test on new fork
Added UTs and some further test in py script
Added regtest flag for skipping fork check in rpc cmds
Removed regtest option after code review
Added test of sending signed tx in py script

prs.title: HF for zend migration and new optional flag for stop block processing at a set height
prs.truncated_body:
Modified the HF in order to stop all TXs from flowing in the network but coinbase TXs.

Also, introduced an optional flag, configurable at zend node startup, that limits block processing beyond a specified height.

See JIRA tasks at:
https://horizenlabs.atlassian.net/browse/HZN-2258

commits.message: First implementation for new fork point that prevents creation of new sidechains and ft to existing  ones
Added first implementation for py test on new fork
Added UTs and some further test in py script
Added regtest flag for skipping fork check in rpc cmds
First implementation for option that limit the max height that a node can reach when processing blocks
Removed regtest option after code review
Added test of sending signed tx in py script
Changed fork name and logic for stopping all transactions
Added some more point in the py test
WIP: adding a test for certificates after HF in py script
Added test for empty certificate after stop tx fork

prs.title: Remove copied readable and writable kv state classes v2
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
In this PR the copied `ReadableKVStateBase` and `WritableKVStateBase` from the platform API are now removed. A new implementation of Guava's `ForwardingConcurrentMap` is added that now delegates the `Map` function calls to our scoped transaction's readable and writable caches.

Fixes #10487

**Checklist**

- [x] Documented (Code comments, README, etc.)
- [x] Tested (unit,

commits.message:
Remove copied readable and writable kv state classes

prs.title: Improve rebuild cache - Add IPC for status
prs.truncated_body:
# Candle Cache Process Manager (Separated IPC Keys)

This document describes the enhanced candle cache refresh system that runs candle cache rebuilds in independent processes with class-specific status tracking using separated IPC keys.

## Overview

The candle cache refresh endpoints have been refactored to use a process manager that:

1. **Runs rebuilds in independent processes** - The a
